name: Jennifer Tull
blurb: Ms. Turner, who is board certified in Family Law by the Texas Board of Legal Specialization since 1994, has practiced exclusively family law since 1989. She has had the experience of working in large family practices in Dallas, Texas her entire career until she branched out into her own firm in 2012. Karen brings with her an abundance of experience in all areas of family law, but her number one committment is to helping her client through the stressful experience associated with family law conflicts.
legal_orgs: Practice emphasizes Traditional Client Representation and Litigation as well as Collaborative Law. Marital property agreements, custody modifications, paternity suits, divorces, mediations, trial work, enforcements and complex property cases.

name: Ellen Yarrell
blurb:
Practicing law in Harris county and surrounding counties since 1986 as well as being a member of AAML and TAFLS with a Board Certification in Family Law by Texas Board of Legal Specialization, Sam "Trey" Yates, III, is able to bring clients the unique advantage only years in the courtroom can afford. With a primary focus on divorce, child custody, complex marital property division, will contests and guardianship litigation, Trey embraces the philosophy that his clients need all the relevant information available to make an informed decision as they navigate through the maze of trial or mediation.

A civil law trial practice since 1986 Law Office of Sam M. (Trey) Yates, III, P.C. in Harris, Fort Bend, Brazoria, Montgomery and Galveston counties with a primary focus on family law litigation, probate/guardianship litigation and basic estate planning services. Experienced in collaborative family law, mediation and court appointments as a child representative.

Martindale-Hubbell CV Peer Review Rated.
